clinical_study.brief_title: Controlled Trial Evaluating the Efficacy of Protein Supplementation in the Short Term After Bariatric Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Controlled Trial Prospective Single-center Open Evaluating the Efficacy of Supplementation (Adapted to the Post-operative Period) Current Protein After Bariatric Surgery Like Sleeve Gastrectomy

brief_summary.textblock:
The main objective will be to evaluate the effect at 5 weeks of nutritional management associated with protein supplementation (adapted to the post-operative period) on the maintenance of lean body mass at the whole body in obese patients after a sleeve gastrectomy.
Secondary objectives will assess protein intake, food safety, the effect of protein supplementation on body fat in the entire body and the metabolic rate and the impact on quality of life and post-operative joint pain.

detailed_description.textblock:
The main objective will be to evaluate the effect at 5 weeks of nutritional management associated with protein supplementation (adapted to the post-operative period) on the maintenance of lean body mass at the whole body in obese patients after a sleeve gastrectomy.
Secondary objectives will assess protein intake, food safety, the effect of protein supplementation on body fat in the entire body and the metabolic rate and the impact on quality of life and post-operative joint pain.
There is still no study evaluating the protein supplementation adapted patients after sleeve gastrectomy on maintaining lean body mass.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in lean mass (kg) will be assessed at the level of whole-body dual-energy X-ray absorptiometry (DXA)

secondary_outcome.description: The actual protein intake will be assessed using a food diary over 5 weeks completed by the patient
change rate IGF1, IGFBP3 between hospitalization and 1 month of hospital discharge
The evolution of the quality of life will be assessed through a specific scale, Baros score.

arm_group.description: Control group: usual dietary management Following the intervention, the stomach of patients underwent many changes

arm_group.arm_group_label: care of with usual dietary protein supplementation
arm_group.description: Intervention group: Usual dietary management with protein supplementation (30g) in addition to the usual inputs

intervention.description: Protein supplementation : Protein intake of 30 grams of protein in addition to the usual inputs (to the recommended amounts of 60 to 120 g per day), upon the resumption of oral intake until the fifth week after sleeve gastrectomy.
intervention.arm_group_label: care of with usual dietary protein supplementation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- surgical management of sleeve gastrectomy kind
Exclusion Criteria:
- food allergies
- Weight> 135 kg (maximum weight supported by the DXA)
- orthopedic prosthesis (hip, knee ...) that would make it impossible to interpret the measurement of DXA
- History of bariatric surgery: adjustable gastric banding, vertical banded gastrectomy ...
